fields.Title: PLAZA / GASTON SANDWICH WC
START
input
Gaston Martin: "The sandwich owner looks at you, ey..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The sandwich owner looks at you, eyes filled with anguish. "You're describing prison food, officer. I like different, *better* food. Fine dining, not *jailtime*. Please, just drop it."

fields.Title: Savoir Faire: "Not speaking from experience, but y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Not speaking from experience, but yes, you can. It's a common practice among the slug-enthusiasts.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Gaston main HUB]
Rhetoric: "A man so principled about his sandw..."
fields.Dialogue Text: A man so principled about his sandwich calls for a principled approach. Time to get political.

fields.Title: You: ""I admire your handiwork,*chéf*, bu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I admire your handiwork,*chéf*, but there are a few things I'd do differently."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Well yes, I mean... uh... no need..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Well yes, I mean... uh... no need to..." He raises his arms to signal you to stop. "I'm not sure I understand what's happening here, officer."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh..." he looks down for the longe..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh..." he looks down for the longest time. "You're right of course, officer. It can't be good for my health. Please, take it off my hands."

fields.Title: You: ""Envision bread as black as the soi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Envision bread as black as the soil it came from..."

fields.Title: You: "I'm already tripping knee-deep in p..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm already tripping knee-deep in politics, baby.

fields.Title: Volition: "Whoa... easy there, Gold Mouth. He..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Whoa... easy there, Gold Mouth. He doesn't *have* to say anything. Re-engage cop-mode and bail out, if you like.

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "No. You're gonna starve to death."
fields.Dialogue Text: No. You're gonna starve to death.

fields.Title: You: "Point to the sandwich in silence."
fields.Dialogue Text: Point to the sandwich in silence.

fields.Title: You: ""No. No one can." (Gaze at the dist..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No. No one can." (Gaze at the distance, slowly shaking your head.)

fields.Title: You: ""But imagine a sandwich covered ent..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "But imagine a sandwich covered entirely in fine metal dust from an industrial plant..."

fields.Title: RENELOATHE
Rhetoric: "Too late. Daddy's already fighting..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Too late. Daddy's already fighting the bad fight. Make it stick.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""I'm not going to listen to this co..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm not going to listen to this commie-*connerie*," he utters through clenched teeth and turns his back to you.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I really don't understand how my s..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I really don't understand how my sandwich could..." he starts, but falls silent.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Gaston main HUB]
Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm actually already a member in a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm actually already a member in a group tasked to keep the streets safe," the lieutenant marks. "You are too. We call ourselves *The Police*."

fields.Title: You: ""Good good, now that this is done -..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Good good, now that this is done -- GIVE ME THE SANDWICH!"

fields.Title: Authority: "Ignore him. You are addressing the..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Ignore him. You are addressing the entire group now.

fields.Title: You: ""I got a keen eye and it's telling..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I got a keen eye and it's telling me this sandwich is gonna destroy your back."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Ee... okay, sure sure, I'm not wor..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ee... okay, sure sure, I'm not worried. We're here all the time. Every day. Impossible to miss us, officer."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "Say one of these fascist or communi..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Say one of these fascist or communist things or fuck off.

fields.Title: You: ""Suzerain Solution?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Suzerain Solution?"

fields.Title: You: ""The Three Boiadeiros?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Three Boiadeiros?"

fields.Title: You: ""I... I win...?""
Gaston Martin: ""Ee... okay, sure sure," he quiets..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Ee... okay, sure sure," he quiets you. "Everybody wins, but is there anything I can help you with right now to *speed up* the process?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""That *would* certainly have been a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That *would* certainly have been an improvement."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I hope you are not just tricking a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I hope you are not just tricking an old man out of the little he has left." He says solemnly and hands you his sandwich.

fields.Title: You: ""Sure, but I'm going to need yours..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Sure, but I'm going to need yours as a *prototype* first."

fields.Title: You: ""Look, comrade, the *over-abundance..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Look, comrade, the *over-abundance* this sandwich embodies is inherently evil."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""What do you mean, officer?" There'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What do you mean, officer?" There's a look of suspicion is his eyes.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Gaston main HUB]
Rhetoric: "No time to bring him in. Just keep..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No time to bring him in. Just keep your eyes on the prize and ignore him.

fields.Title: You: ""Cause that's how foreigners *are*,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Cause that's how foreigners *are*, Gaston. They won't stop 'till you have nothing left."

fields.Title: Untitled hub
Gaston Martin: ""I'm listening, officer." He nods."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'm listening, officer." He nods.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Gaston main HUB]
You: "I'm not so sure about this..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm not so sure about this...

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "And now we both walk away and every..."
fields.Dialogue Text: And now we both walk away and everybody lives.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Like what, officer?" His eyes rest..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Like what, officer?" His eyes rest on the sandwich. "This is as good as they come in Revachol, I assure you."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""*Ce serait délicieux*! he shouts e..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "*Ce serait délicieux*! he shouts excitedly. "Can you make that sandwich, officer?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""That sounds *horrible*." A grimace..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "That sounds *horrible*." A grimace of disgust runs over his jolly face. "You really don't know your way around the kitchen, officer. Food and politics don't mix."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""He won't care." The old veteran gl..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "He won't care." The old veteran glances at his partner. "As long as there's food in his fat belly, he'll lick any boot that's kicking it to him..."

fields.Title: You: ""We'll be unit one, *Ghost Dogs*. Y..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "We'll be unit one, *Ghost Dogs*. You and Gaston are unit two -- *The Royal Hounds*."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "Sorry, but at this point, all that'..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Sorry, but at this point, all that's left to do is beg and hope for the best. Beg like you've never begged before.

fields.Title: You: ""Back to police-mode." (Smile and n..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Back to police-mode." (Smile and nod.) "I have some questions, Gaston."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""No, everything would fall off," he..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No, everything would fall off," he argues, glancing at you worriedly. "Look, officer, I'm not a miner. I like different, *tasty* food. Fine dining, not coal. Please, just drop it."

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""It's dignified. I like it. We need..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's dignified. I like it. We need dignity. And you..." He points to Gaston. "Get excited."

fields.Title: Logic: "No problem, you just need *his* for..."
fields.Dialogue Text: No problem, you just need *his* for research and development first. Just as a prototype of course. Stall now and the sandwich is forever lost.

fields.Title: You: ""The bread you built this wonder on..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "The bread you built this wonder on, could have been toasted beforehand."

fields.Title: You: ""No, that's too old school. How abo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No, that's too old school. How about...?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Eh... I don't think that's gonna h..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Eh... I don't think that's gonna happen." He chuckles. "Why would you even...?"

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "Tell this lost comrade what the Peo..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Tell this lost comrade what the People's Sandwich would be like. Distil the essence of the Working Man... in a sandwich.

fields.Title: Authority: "His tone leaves no room for argumen..."
fields.Dialogue Text: His tone leaves no room for arguments. Giving orders is a second skin to the old carabineer.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I don't want to," he argues, glanc..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't want to," he argues, glancing at you worriedly. "Look, officer, I like different, *classic* food. Fine dining, not soil. Please, just drop it."

fields.Title: You: ""Men, let's review and, possibly, *..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Men, let's review and, possibly, *redistribute* our resources." (Continue.)

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Alright." The jolly man smiles. "L..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Alright." The jolly man smiles. "Let's hear them, officer."

fields.Title: You: ""The Migrant Bashers?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Migrant Bashers?"

fields.Title: You: "What is *political*?"
fields.Dialogue Text: What is *political*?

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Huh?" The jolly man is scratching..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Huh?" The jolly man is scratching his head in bewilderment. He doesn't understand the situation.

fields.Title: Endurance: "You're not. Everything is fine."
fields.Dialogue Text: You're not. Everything is fine.

fields.Title: IsKimHere()
IsKimHere()
!(IsKimHere())
You: ""Guillaume's Millions?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Guillaume's Millions?"

fields.Title: You: ""I'll do you one better -- the air..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'll do you one better -- the air pocket between cheese and ham could house pre-roasted paprika."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "All right, this is how we're gonna..."
fields.Dialogue Text: All right, this is how we're gonna do it:
fields.Alternate1: All right, this is how we're gonna do it. Diplomacy or blackmail. Blackmail is quick and efficient. Leaves less loose ends.

fields.Title: You: ""Revachol Curbstompers?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Revachol Curbstompers?"

fields.Title: You: ""Now turn it upside down, black bre..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Now turn it upside down, black bread -- like a symbol -- on top, to salute the coal mines our heroes worked."

fields.Title: You: ""Revachol is calling -- she needs u..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Revachol is calling -- she needs us. Not tomorrow, not *soon*, but right now. Let's take our home back."

fields.Title: You: ""On second thought... I don't wanna..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "On second thought... I don't wanna organize a vigilante group after all." (Drop it.)

fields.Title: You: ""Initial development takes time of..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Initial development takes time of course, but in six to nine months you *will* eat 'The Sandwich of Gods'."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I understand the situation," he sa..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I understand the situation," he says quietly and hands you the sandwich. "Please... just take it slowly. Give her the attention she deserves."

fields.Title: You: ""Don't worry, about it." (Give him..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Don't worry, about it." (Give him a wink.)

fields.Title: You: ""This city's going to shit. Sooner..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "This city's going to shit. Sooner or later some foreign anarchist is gonna *steal* your sandwich. That's a fact."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Yes, officer." He proudly displays..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Yes, officer." He proudly displays his culinary miracle. It is magnificent.

fields.Dialogue Text: "It's weird. I don't like it. We'll go with mine for now and you..." He points to Gaston. "Get excited."

fields.Dialogue Text: "Nothing. Actually, let's talk about something else."

fields.Dialogue Text: "Stop it! I *just* want the sandwich. Give it to me!"

You: "I'm not gonna beg."
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm not gonna beg.

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "He's not imagining it."
fields.Dialogue Text: He's not imagining it.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Alright, alright," the old man is..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Alright, alright," the old man is taken aback by René's commanding tone, but dares not dispute him. "I have a bad feeling about this."

fields.Title: You: ""Just one small thing -- your sandw..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Just one small thing -- your sandwich. I wanna hold it for a moment."

fields.Title: Visual Calculus: "He looks worried."
fields.Dialogue Text: He looks worried.

fields.Title: You: ""Just give me the damn sandwich, so..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Just give me the damn sandwich, so I don't have to explain."

fields.Title: You: ""How is your back, Gaston?" (Tap on..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "How is your back, Gaston?" (Tap on the side of your nose and point to the sandwich.)  "Is it... *jerky*?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""*Mon dieu*, that is an excellent i..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "*Mon dieu*, that is an excellent idea!" he exclaims. "That would virtually negate the component loss."

fields.Title: You: ""The Lawbringers?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Lawbringers?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""How about what?!" Judging by his t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "How about what?!" Judging by his tone the old carabineer really wanted to honour his old unit.

fields.Title: You: ""It's got class. And roots. I like..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's got class. And roots. I like it."

fields.Title: You: "These options seem awfully fascist..."
fields.Dialogue Text: These options seem awfully fascist or communist -- what if I don't wanna say them?
fields.Alternate1: There really isn't *anything* else I could say?

fields.Title: You: ""I don't either, but wouldn't you r..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't either, but wouldn't you rather eat a sandwich free of the *bourgeois* guilt-baggage?"

fields.Title: You: ""Melting butter, yellow like the su..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Melting butter, yellow like the sun shining on the backs of workers on the fields..."

fields.Title: IsKimHere()
IsKimHere()
!(IsKimHere())
René Arnoux: ""Goddamnit, son..." He pushes back..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Goddamnit, son..." He pushes back his cap. "Once you realize Martinaise -- all of Revachol -- is *actually* going to shit, it will be too late."

fields.Title: You: ""Actually, let's honour your old un..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Actually, let's honour your old unit -- *Épées de la Couronne* it is!"

fields.Title: Interfacing: "This calls for an engineering angle..."
fields.Dialogue Text: This calls for an engineering angle. Structural rigidity, exposed rafters, lattice-works -- that type of approach.

Variable["plaza.gaston_interfacing_go_structural_with_sandwich"]

Logic: "Lattice-works? Like *Lettuce-works*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Lattice-works? Like *Lettuce-works*? I see what you did there. Don't ever do that again.

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""It's dignified. We need dignity. A..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's dignified. We need dignity. And you..." He points to Gaston. "Get excited."

fields.Title: You: ""I'll be unit one, *Ghost Dog*. You..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I'll be unit one, *Ghost Dog*. You and Gaston are unit two -- *The Royal Hounds*."

fields.Title: You: ""Wouldn't you rather have a proper..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Wouldn't you rather have a proper sandwich? A sandwich with a soul?"

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What the hell are you talking abou..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What the hell are you talking about? What *foreign anarchist*?" the lieutenant asks, confused.

fields.Title: Suggestion: "Manipulating his patriotic impulses..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Manipulating his patriotic impulses like that? René is gonna remember that.

fields.Title: Jump to: [Gaston main HUB]
Drama: "He knows exactly what's going on."
fields.Dialogue Text: He knows exactly what's going on.

fields.Title: Encyclopedia: "An array of delicious recipes flash..."
fields.Dialogue Text: An array of delicious recipes flashes through your mind. Salads... Salmon... Sandwiches. Bingo!

fields.Title: You: ""Salt is essential -- there can't b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Salt is essential -- there can't be too much -- because isn't proletariat the salt of society?"

fields.Title: You: ""Let me ask you, comrade, did *you*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Let me ask you, comrade, did *you* make the sandwich yourself?"

Gaston Martin: ""No, officer." The culinary genius..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "No, officer." The culinary genius shakes his head with unexpected resolve. "Please let it go, It's making me really uncomfortable."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "Good, René's on board too -- time t..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Good, René's on board too -- time to take back the streets. Right-wing populism, here we come!

fields.Title: Suggestion: "Whatever you're selling there -- he..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Whatever you're selling there -- he's buying it. In bulk.

fields.Title: You: ""Kim, I got this." (Wink at him.)"
fields.Dialogue Text: "Kim, I got this." (Wink at him.)

fields.Title: RENELOVE
Rhetoric: "*This* right here is political..."
fields.Dialogue Text: *This* right here is political...

fields.Title: You: ""The Filippian Four?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Filippian Four?"

fields.Title: Jump to: [sandwichhubthing]
You: ""Frissel Firing Squad?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Frissel Firing Squad?"

fields.Title: You: ""It's okay, Gaston, just *please* g..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "It's okay, Gaston, just *please* give me the sandwich now."

fields.Title: Electrochemistry: "Beautiful, now bring it home with p..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Beautiful, now bring it home with paprika.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Or god of sandwiches maybe?" he tr..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Or god of sandwiches maybe?" he tries to pitch in. "But in the meanwhile, what can I do for you *here* and *now* officer?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Is there anything I can do for you..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Is there anything I can do for you right now?" he asks. "Maybe to speed the whole process up a bit?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: "The old man nods and turns away fro..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The old man nods and turns away from you.

fields.Title: You: ""Your blood-sandwich" (point to it)..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Your blood-sandwich" (point to it) "is a tool of the oppressors, designed to keep the proletariat docile."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: "The scepticism emanating from the m..."
fields.Dialogue Text: The scepticism emanating from the merry senior could be sensed all the way to the Semenine Isles.

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I don't eat worker-food!" he blurt..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I don't eat worker-food!" he blurts out, immediately regretting it. "Look, officer, I like different, *classic* food. Fine dining, not *worker backs*. Please, just drop it."

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""Oh..." His eyes light up in unders..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh..." His eyes light up in understanding. "All that for a sandwich? I'm flattered, officer, but you can't have it. It's mine."

fields.Title: Jump to: [Gaston main HUB]
You: ""Had you put a large slice of Olduv..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Had you put a large slice of Olduvaian cheese crosswise from the ham, it would minimize the component loss via crumbling."

fields.Title: You: ""The Vigil Flame?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "The Vigil Flame?"

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""*Now* you are talking sense, son."..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "*Now* you are talking sense, son." His eyes light up. "All three of us, working as a group -- we can make a difference."
fields.Alternate1: "*Now* you are talking sense, son." His eyes light up. "All four of us, working as a group -- we can make a difference."

IsKimHere()
!(IsKimHere())

fields.Dialogue Text: "Are you sure?" The lieutenant raises his eyebrows. "Cause right now it looks like you're organizing a vigilante group."

fields.Title: Untitled hub (02)
Jump to: [René Arnoux: ""It's dignified. We need dignity. A..."]
You: ""Oh...? Still, the *over-abundance*..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh...? Still, the *over-abundance* this sandwich embodies is inherently evil."

fields.Title: Conceptualization: "I'm sure we can come up with someth..."
fields.Dialogue Text: I'm sure we can come up with something with a bit more *oomph* than that.

fields.Title: You: ""First they take our jobs, then our..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "First they take our jobs, then our women and when the sandwich is all you have left -- the anarchists will come for that too."

fields.Title: You: ""But imagine a sandwich absolutely..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "But imagine a sandwich absolutely minimal in design. Sleek, efficient, simple."

fields.Title: You: ""Don't you guys get it? Us, local b..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Don't you guys get it? Us, local boys, gotta stick together. Make the people feel safe again."

fields.Title: Rhetoric: "It's probably for the best. People..."
fields.Dialogue Text: It's probably for the best. People don't like beggars.

fields.Title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What?" The lieutenant gives you a..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "What?" The lieutenant gives you a sharp glance. "What *oppressors*?"

fields.Title: Jump to: [Authority: "His tone leaves no room for argumen..."]
Gaston Martin: ""Oh..." His eyes light up in unders..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Oh..." His eyes light up in understanding. "You went through all that trouble for my sandwich? I'm flattered, officer, but my answer is no. Now how else can I help you?"

fields.Title: Half Light: "Oh my god, stop this scheming and j..."
fields.Dialogue Text: Oh my god, stop this scheming and just demand the sandwich!

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Goddamnit..." the old carabineer l..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Goddamnit..." the old carabineer looks at you, disgusted. "I thought I had you measured, but you can't really measure a slug, can you?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: "He nods, understanding the finality..."
fields.Dialogue Text: He nods, understanding the finality of the situation, and hands you the sandwich. "Please... just take it slowly. Give her the attention she deserves."

fields.Title: sandwichhubthing
Rhetoric: "You really do. Now, *unleash the fu..."
fields.Dialogue Text: You really do. Now, *unleash the fury*!

fields.Title: René Arnoux: ""Agreed. What about the whole group..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Agreed. What about the whole group?" He quickly adds: "I propose *Épées de la Couronne* -- Swords of the Crown, in honour of my old unit."

fields.Title: You: ""Guillaume's Lions?""
fields.Dialogue Text: "Guillaume's Lions?"

fields.Title: Gaston Martin: ""I would rather just have this one,..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "I would rather just have this one, officer." He's avoiding your eyes. "It's really good."

fields.Title: You: ""Please, please, just *PLEASE* let..."
fields.Dialogue Text: "Please, please, just *PLEASE* let me have the sandwich, Gaston!"
